intro: Cynoglossospermum consanguineum, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in xerophytic ecosystems.
